qas.question: What increase the significance of Friendly's since the nineteenth century?

context: In the early days of <b4_0>association football<b4_0/>, known simply as football or soccer, <a0_0>friendly matches (or "friendlies")<a0_0/> were the most common type of match. However, since the development of The Football League in England in <a1_0><b5_0>1888<b5_0/><a1_0/>, <b6_0>league tournaments<b6_0/> became established, in addition to lengthy derby and cup tournaments. By the year <a2_0><b7_0>2000<b7_0/><a2_0/>, national leagues were established in almost every country throughout the world, as well as <b8_0>local or regional leagues for lower level teams<b8_0/>, thus <a3_0>the significance of friendlies<a3_0/> has seriously declined since the 19th century.
